medical_history.chief_complaint: Acanthamoeba keratitis with severe reactive ischemic posterior segment inflammation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with pain and redness in the left eye, evolving over several months. Patients reported worsening vision, pain, and the eventual need for enucleation due to vision deterioration.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patients had varying histories including type 2 diabetes mellitus and heterozygous factor V Leiden mutation.
medical_history.social_history: All patients were reported as contact lens wearers. One patient was noted to have not rinsed lenses with tap water or swim while wearing them.
